page.title: 14Policing in St.Ouen.
page.content: There are two categories of police: the{States Police}and the{Honorary {Parish police.} This is a system of policing that is unique in the British Isles. The honorary police in the parish are all elected. These include {The Constable,}who is also civil head of the Parish, the Centeniers and other lesser officers. The officers of the States Police, based in St Helier, have powers similar to their U.K. counterparts in the town parish but, in the country parishes, do not have the power to{charge}anyone. The authority to charge is vested in the Honorary Police. The States Police patrol the parish as part of their duties using both motor bikes and cars thus covering the parish for the whole 24 hours.
